about_the_game:
«Are we alone?»

WARNING:

Epileptic seizures associated with increased sensitivity to light are Possible. Some people may experience seizures when exposed to flashes of light and flashing images that appear in a video game. People who have not previously experienced such attacks may not be aware of their illness. A reasonable restriction of the game audience is recommended.

"Screaming In The Basement" is a first-person psychological thriller horror game. The game takes place in 1991.

Average time to complete the game: 120 minutes

The main character is mike, an experienced journalist who always strives to uncover the truth, He manages to gain access to the apartment, According to locals, restless souls inhabit this place, but this needs to be confirmed, which is guarded by the police, in connection with a terrible incident. Mike, a talented journalist with many experiences, there was a family in the apartment consisting of a father, mother and daughter who were killed by someone whose identity is still unknown.

In 1990, the family lived in a house in Russia and decided to buy a new one there. They bought the house from someone named Robert. After they moved into the house and the first night there was a noise coming from the basement they did not know what that noise was. Because that place was cursed. So they left the place and went to Chicago.

Do you have the courage to face the nightmare and reveal the truth behind that fateful night?

What awaits you:

- The main genre of the game is "Walking Simulator";

- Gameplay is close to realism;

- The narrative unfolds through the player's recordings and actions;

- Tense atmosphere;

- VHS cassette effect.

- Take your time while exploring; hidden secrets, notes, and clues might be waiting to be uncovered.

- The soundtrack will immerse you even more into the world of "Screaming In The Basement".

content_descriptors.notes: The game contains images of scenes of violence that can have a negative impact on the psyche. Some content items may not be suitable for certain age categories. A reasonable restriction of the game audience is recommended.
